metadata.title: CVE-2023-38622 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the VZT facgeometryparsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .vzt file canlead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a maliciousfile to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns theinteger overflow when allocating the `len` array.

criterions.comment: gtkwave package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
